item.title: Robin add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Robin add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Robin add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Robin add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "When you read a great book, you don’t escape from life, you plunge deeper into it. There may be a superficial escape – into different countries, mores, speech patterns – but what you are essentially doing is furthering your understanding of life’s subtleties, paradoxes, joys, pains and truths. Reading and life are not separate but symbiotic." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Robin add a quote by United Nations
item.description: "Everyone has the right to the protection of the moral and material interests resulting from any scientific, literary or artistic production of which he is the author." -- United Nations

item.title: Robin add a quote by Billie Joe Armstrong
item.description: "A guy walks up to me and asks, "What's Punk?". So I kick over a garbage can and say. "That's punk!". So he kicks over the garbage can and says, "That's Punk?", and I say, "No that's trendy!" -- Billie Joe Armstrong

item.title: Robin add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand." -- Woodrow Wilson
